The movie "The English Patient" is a historical drama film directed by David Lean. It stars Ryan O'Connell as William Foster, Kristin Scott Thomas as Margaret Lea, and Ralph Fiennes as King Edward VIII.
The plot of the movie "The English Patient" centers on an airplane crash in the Italian Alps. The crash victim, William Foster, is a famous surgeon who has just returned to his post after serving as Lord Varenna to King Edward VIII.
When the plane crash happens, Foster is badly burned and left for dead by other survivors. However, days later, Foster unexpectedly wakes up from his coma.
As Foster awakens from his coma, he finds himself in a terrible situation. Because of his burns, Foster has lost most of his ability to speak. As a result, he has become virtually isolated from the rest of the world.
In this terrible situation, Foster finds himself with the help of Margaret Lea, a nurse who has been caring for Foster in his hospital room.
Through their shared experiences, Foster and Margaret Lea develop a deep mutual respect and understanding that helps Foster to come to terms with the terrible situation that he finds himself in.
